resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: [Python] Failed to install pyarrow 0.15.1 on Python 3.8

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

fields.summary: `pip install pyarrow` with python 3.8 fail with message : Could not build wheels for pyarrow which use PEP 517 and cannot be installed directly

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

kszucs commented on issue #5685: ARROW-6920: [Packaging] Build python 3.8 wheels
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5685#issuecomment-543292551
 
 
   Well, we'll need to add a couple more thing:
   - on windows we use conda forge to build the wheels, so I'm afraid we need to wait until they ship python 3.8
   - the manylinux containers don't contain the 3.8 interpreters so we need to add it and rebuild both manylinux1 and manylinux2010
   - osx wheels dependent on #5647

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
There are currently no wheels available in pypi for python3.8. This means it's not possible to install later versions of arrow from pypi as the latest uploaded source release is 0.14.0.

It would also be useful to upload source releases to pypi...

comments.body:
[~sjhewitt] Please have a look at the code and make a PR. It could be simple to add Python 3.8 but there is currently no maintanence of the wheel build setup happening.

Also source tarballs won't work in your case as they are missing the C++ libraries.
Hello, I would be very interested in wheel for 3.8 on pypi, any idea when this will be available ?
